After the last contest, someone suggested that I make a puzzle about seed finding. As it is a complex subject, I think it is best if it is broken down into a multi-part puzzle and the concepts introduced gradually. This is the first part, if people like it I'll think about the next one.

The goal of this puzzle is to introduce what is an LCG and how it can be reversed and made to skip values.

Thanks. I've done the corrections.

I expect people to solve it on their own. There is a few properties to notice, maybe I could add them as hints ?

* any combination of an lcg is also an lcg (so the problem boils down to find the new a and c)
* once you get the generic formula for large forward steps, the same formula works for backward steps

The formula can also be worked out by posing the (congruent) equation on paper, starting with only skipping 1 call. To this end, I've made the first example small enough it can be worked by hand.

If you have suggestions how I can guide people better, I can add them. (It does require them to know about congruential equations, which is something studied in high school).

What helped me to figure out negative steps was instead of writing it as:

lcg(seed) = (a * seed + c) % m

was to instead think of it as 

lcg(seed_0, 1) = seed_1 = (a * seed_0 + c) % m

This makes it more obvious (to me) that this operation is reversible.

Related: The composability of lcgs is non-obvious, but critical to solving this problem. (Otherwise you can't solve the massive step sizes.) A hint that would have made things easier for me would be:

lcg(seed_0, 2) = seed_2 = a * (a * seed_0 + c) + c % m
lcg(seed_0, 3) = seed_3 = lcg(lcg(seed_0, 1), 2)

I guess it comes down to - is figuring this out part of the question, or is the intent for the answerer to have to look this up?

Hi, the best resources I found are this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mc9w2iD3Gzs and the latticg source code: https://github.com/mjtb49/LattiCG

The goal of this puzzle is to introduce the concepts gradually, so it is a part of the solution. (Being able to go forward and backward is really the first step in seed finding and can be used with many techniques from bruteforce to lattices)
